Punya Lima PR Pariwisata, Wishnutama Diminta Mencontoh Portugal
04 Nov 2019, 04:35 by Antara, Rahma Tri
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Menteri Pariwisata dan Ekonomi Kreatif (Menparekraf) Wishnutama Kusubandio diharapkan segera mengatasi lima pekerjaan rumahnya di bidang industri pariwisata.
"Pertama, bagaimana meningkatkan pendapatan devisa terkait pengeluaran dan lama masa tinggal wisatawan mancanegara,” kata pakar marketing pariwisata halal Bayu Endro Winarko di Jakarta, Senin 4 November 2019.
Bayu yang juga Ketua Bidang Analisis Kebijakan Publik Generasi Optimis (GO) Indonesia menekankan persoalan kedua terkait pengembangan program-program untuk meningkatkan kunjungan wisatawan mancanegara ke Indonesia yang masih rendah. Adapun PR ketiga adalah program peningkatan kesiapan dan daya dukung destinasi wisata, seperti situasi keamanan, transportasi, hotel, akomodasi, dan kesiapan masyarakat menyambut tamu di daerah mereka.
“Keempat, adanya program peningkatan kualitas, profesionalisme, dan jumlah SDM pariwisata,” kata Bayu yang juga pernah menjadi Tim Ahli Tourism 4.0 itu.
Pekerjaan rumah terakhir, kata dia, adalah soal pembenahan infrastruktur dan konektivitas yang mudah dan nyaman bagi wisatawan mancanegara.
Bayu mendorong Menparekraf Wishnutama dan Wamenparekraf Angela Tanoesudibjo untuk belajar dari Portugal yang sukses menjadi The World’s Leading Destination."Kita bisa mengadopsi dan mengadaptasi cara Portugal. Setidaknya arah kebijakan boleh diarahkan kepada peningkatan ekosistem usaha pariwisata, termasuk menyesuaikan dengan era Tourism 4.0," kata pria asal Jombang, Jawa Timur itu.
Peningkatan Access, Amenity, dan Attraction, serta kenyamanan dan keamanan lingkungan destinasi pariwisata, menurut Bayu, juga perlu mendapat perhatian khusus. "Peningkatan citra melalui komunikasi pemasaran yang terintegrasi dan pembangunan SDM pariwisata, juga harus ditingkatkan. Manusia harus menjadi jantung industri pariwisata dan sudah selayaknya menjadi prioritas kebijakan Kemenparekraf," kata Bayu yang juga tim penulis buku The Ma'ruf Amin Way itu.
Sekretaris Jenderal (Sekjen) Generasi Optimis Indonesia, Tigor Mulo Horas Sinaga yakin, dengan prestasi yang dimiliki Wishnutama, termasuk kesuksesannya sebagai anggota tim penyelenggara Asian Games 2019, ia akan bisa memberikan sumbangsih terobosan dalam pembangunan sektor pariwisata di Indonesia. "Selain itu, didampingi oleh Wamen Angela yang berlatar belakang pengusaha milenial, maka mereka diharapkan bisa saling melengkapi dalam memimpin kementerian yang sekarang menjadi salah satu penghasil devisa terbesar," kata Horas.
Ia mengingatkan potensi pengunjung pariwisata ke depan adalah generasi milenial. "Kami optimistis pariwisata dan ekonomi kreatif kita akan bertumbuh signifikan ke depan,” kata Horas.

Got Five PR Tourism, Wishnutama Asked For Example Portugal
Nov 04 2019, 04:35 by Antara, Rahma Tri
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Minister of Tourism and Creative Economy (Menparekraf) Wishnutama Kusubandio is expected to immediately tackle his five homeworks in the tourism industry.
"First, how to increase foreign exchange earnings related to spending and length of stay of foreign tourists," said halal tourism marketing expert Bayu Endro Winarko in Jakarta, Monday, November 4, 2019.
Bayu who is also the Chairperson of the Optimistic Generation Public Policy Analysis (GO) of Indonesia emphasized the second problem related to the development of programs to increase foreign tourist arrivals to Indonesia which is still low. The third PR is a program to increase the readiness and carrying capacity of tourist destinations, such as the security situation, transportation, hotels, accommodation, and community readiness to welcome guests in their area.
"Fourth, there is a program to improve the quality, professionalism and number of tourism human resources," said Bayu, who was also a Tourism 4.0 Expert Team.
The last homework, he said, is a matter of improving infrastructure and easy and comfortable connectivity for foreign tourists.
Bayu encouraged Menparekraf Wishnutama and Deputy Minister of Tourism and Culture Angela Tanoesudibjo to learn from Portugal that successfully became the World's Leading Destination. "We can adopt and adapt the way of Portugal. At least the policy direction may be directed towards improving the tourism business ecosystem, including adjusting to the era of Tourism 4.0," said the man from Jombang, East Java.
Increasing Access, Amenity, and Attraction, as well as the comfort and safety of the environment of tourism destinations, according to Bayu, also need special attention. "Image enhancement through integrated marketing communication and development of tourism human resources must also be improved. Humans must be at the heart of the tourism industry and it should be a priority in the Kemenparekraf policy," said Bayu, who is also the author of the book The Ma'ruf Amin Way.
Secretary General (Secretary General) of the Indonesian Optimistic Generation, Tigor Mulo Horas Sinaga believes, with the achievements of Wishnutama, including his success as a member of the 2019 Asian Games organizing team, he will be able to contribute to breakthroughs in the development of the tourism sector in Indonesia. "In addition, accompanied by Vice Minister Angela who has a millennial background, they are expected to complement each other in leading the ministry which is now one of the largest foreign exchange earners," Horas said.
He reminded that the potential for tourism visitors in the future is millennial generation. "We are optimistic that our tourism and creative economy will grow significantly in the future," Horas said.
